snippet: The most recently completed section of Water Tunnel No. 3, considered the largest capital construction project ever undertaken in New York City, was opened on Wednesday.
abstract: Mayor Michael R Bloomberg turns ceremonial wheel in New York's City Hall Park, sending water from Water Tunnel No 3 into a fountain, and bringing city to seminal moment; tunnel, begun in 1970 and considered largest capital construction project ever undertaken in the five boroughs, is now equipped to provide water to all of Manhattan; borough has relied on Tunnel No 1, which was never inspected or significantly repaired since its opening in 1917.
lead_paragraph: The most recently completed section of Water Tunnel No. 3, considered the largest capital construction project ever undertaken in New York City, was opened on Wednesday.

headline.main: After Decades, a Water Tunnel Can Now Serve All of Manhattan
headline.print_headline: After Decades, A Water Tunnel Can Now Serve All of Manhattan
